posts.post_content: Beautiful art and flavor text, but I don't like it. You pay five mana and wait to be damaged for the opportunity to spend two *more* mana to gain two life and a card. [Survival Cache](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Survival Cache) is so much better than this it's not even funny. 2.5/5

Beautiful art and flavor text, but I don't like it. You pay five mana and wait to be damaged for the opportunity to spend two more mana to gain two life and a card. Survival Cache is so much better than this it's not even funny. 2.5/5

Posted By: dudecow (4/16/2010 6:46:12 PM)

posts.post_content: Nice, but not 5 mana nice. It would be great in suicide black if it were cheaper and if it counted losing life as well as damage. Take 2 off the cost, add that in and remove the lifegain and it'd be a cool draw engine. As is it pretty much serves to help a suicide black deck last a little bit more into the midgame, but I'd rather play a card that made sure the game never went that long.
posts.html:

Take 2 off the cost, add that in and remove the lifegain and it'd be a cool draw engine. As is it pretty much serves to help a suicide black deck last a little bit more into the midgame, but I'd rather play a card that made sure the game never went that long.

Posted By: SleetFox (4/17/2010 6:27:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Nice art, horrible card.  
Take [sun droplet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sun droplet) and [farsight mask](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=farsight mask), put them on a pile, bang on them with a hammer until they stop doing their job and you end up with this.  
  
Sun droplet costs 2 mana instead of 5, requires then no more activation costs, and gives you your life back far quicker and twice as efficient as this card.  
  
Farsight mask, while just an average card by itself, at least draws you a card for each creature dealing damage to you, having the change to draw you far more cards than this (and also requires no more activation costs).  
  
This this is just too slow, clunky, ineffective and expensive.
posts.html:
Nice art, horrible card.
Take sun droplet and farsight mask, put them on a pile, bang on them with a hammer until they stop doing their job and you end up with this.

Sun droplet costs 2 mana instead of 5, requires then no more activation costs, and gives you your life back far quicker and twice as efficient as this card.

Farsight mask, while just an average card by itself, at least draws you a card for each creature dealing damage to you, having the change to draw you far more cards than this (and also requires no more activation costs).

This this is just too slow, clunky, ineffective and expensive.

posts.post_content:
When you first pull this out of a booster you get excited, then you read the text. I actually just now noticed the card draw, so it's not quite as bad as I thought, but instead of wasting your 5 mana drop on this you could be putting a serious beater out that might not only stop all that life loss the Vial alleviates, but put some pressure on your opponent.  
  
Best uses for this: non-white/non-blue decks looking for some lifegain or card draw, especially ones with self damage. Could be useful in my W/B Pestilence deck for those few plains I end up with. I get the feeling this can be abused with charge counters. [Coretapper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Coretapper)/[Energy Chamber](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Energy Chamber) or the obvious [Doubling Season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doubling Season)?
posts.html:

Best uses for this: non-white/non-blue decks looking for some lifegain or card draw, especially ones with self damage. Could be useful in my W/B Pestilence deck for those few plains I end up with. I get the feeling this can be abused with charge counters. Coretapper/Energy Chamber or the obvious Doubling Season?

Posted By: Razmataz24 (6/2/2010 1:22:41 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think you're all looking at the card in isolation; and in that light what you're saying is true.
  
   
But it fits perfectly in with the thems of Rise of the Eldrazi. It works well with everything else in Zendikars 3rd act. Five colorless isn't really that much with all the eldrazi colorless mana generators; further more it fulfills one of the main game play changes of the act by slowing the play action down.
  
   
Excellent card for the set.
posts.html:
I think you're all looking at the card in isolation; and in that light what you're saying is true.

But it fits perfectly in with the thems of Rise of the Eldrazi. It works well with everything else in Zendikars 3rd act. Five colorless isn't really that much with all the eldrazi colorless mana generators; further more it fulfills one of the main game play changes of the act by slowing the play action down.

Excellent card for the set.
